definition[0]: the soft part inside your mouth that you can move about and use for eating and speaking
example[0]: Joe ran his tongue over his dry lips.
example[1]: The taste of the chocolate was still on her tongue.
example[2]: The girl scowled at me, then stuck out her tongue.
example[3]: Anton lapsed into his own tongue when he was excited.
example[4]: She felt more comfortable talking in her native tongue.
definition[2]: the tongue of a cow or sheep, cooked and eaten cold
definition[3]: something that has a long thin shape
example[5]: Huge tongues of fire were licking the side of the building.
definition[4]: the part of a shoe that lies on top of your foot, under the part where you tie it
definition[5]: to use your tongue to make separate sounds when playing a musical instrument
definition[6]: to touch something with your tongue
